docs.title: Obsidian Public Knowledge Base
docs.text:
Public knowledge base built with Obsidian and deployed as a static site via MkDocs Material and GitHub Actions.

Repository: github.com/serg-markovich/obsidian-public Live site: notes.serg-markovich.de

docs.title: Problem
docs.text: Obsidian is great for private note-taking, but sharing knowledge publicly requires a separate publishing workflow — without paying for Obsidian Publish.

docs.title: Solution
docs.text: A public subfolder of the Obsidian vault connected to a dedicated git repository. Every git push triggers GitHub Actions which builds a static site with MkDocs Material and deploys it to GitHub Pages under a custom subdomain.

docs.title: Stack
docs.text: Tool Role Obsidian Writing environment MkDocs Material Static site generator GitHub Actions CI/CD — build and deploy on push GitHub Pages Hosting Cloudflare DNS — CNAME to github.io Let's Encrypt SSL — auto via GitHub Pages

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
~/obsidian/public/          ← git root (this repo)
├── .github/workflows/
│   └── deploy.yml          ← GitHub Actions pipeline
├── docs/                   ← all content here
│   ├── index.md
│   ├── azure/
│   ├── devops/
│   ├── homelab/
│   ├── portfolio/
│   └── til/
└── mkdocs.yml              ← site configuration

On every push to main:

  1. GitHub Actions installs mkdocs<2.0 and mkdocs-material
  2. Runs mkdocs gh-deploy --force
  3. Pushes built site to gh-pages branch
  4. GitHub Pages serves it at notes.serg-markovich.de

docs.title: Key decisions
docs.text:
Separate repo from main vault — the public repo has its own git history, independent of private notes. Only content placed in docs/ is published.

MkDocs over Quartz — simpler setup, better Python ecosystem integration, no Node.js dependency.

Manual publishing workflow — no auto-commit on every Obsidian save. Each commit is intentional, resulting in a clean public git history visible to potential employers.

docs.title: TIL: Publishing an Obsidian Vault with MkDocs + GitHub Pages
What I built
docs.text: A public knowledge base at notes.serg-markovich.de from an Obsidian vault using MkDocs Material, GitHub Actions and Cloudflare DNS.

docs.title: 1. Separation of concerns
docs.text: Keep each project in its own repository with independent commit history. The public vault is separate from the main website — different content, different deploy pipelines.

docs.title: 2. Everything as code
docs.text:
All config lives in files — never manual changes in GitHub UI:

  • mkdocs.yml — site configuration
  • .github/workflows/deploy.yml — CI/CD pipeline
  • .gitignore / .gitattributes — repo hygiene

docs.title: 3. CI/CD with GitHub Actions
docs.text: Every git push to main triggers automatic build and deploy. Pin mkdocs<2.0, not mkdocs-material — MkDocs 2.0 is the breaking change.

docs.title: 4. Immutable build artifacts
docs.text: The site/ folder is never committed — generated fresh on every deploy. Add site/ to .gitignore.

docs.title: 5. DNS without proxy for GitHub Pages
docs.text: Cloudflare orange cloud breaks GitHub Pages SSL validation. Use grey cloud (DNS only) with CNAME pointing to serg-markovich.github.io.

docs.title: Actions runs in 15s and silently fails
docs.text:
Cause: YAML syntax error — GitHub ignores invalid workflow files silently. Fix: Recreate with heredoc to avoid indentation issues:

cat > .github/workflows/deploy.yml << 'EOF'
...
EOF

docs.title: Permission denied on git push
docs.text:
Cause: Remote set to SSH, but no key added to GitHub. Fix:

git remote set-url origin https://github.com/user/repo.git

docs.title: GitHub Pages shows Jekyll instead of MkDocs
docs.text:
Cause: Auto-generated jekyll-gh-pages.yml conflicts with custom workflow. Fix:

git rm .github/workflows/jekyll-gh-pages.yml

docs.title: Theme material has no configuration file
docs.text:
Cause: MkDocs 2.0 installed — incompatible with mkdocs-material. Fix:

pip install "mkdocs<2.0" mkdocs-material

docs.title: github-actions[bot] permission denied on push
docs.text:
Cause: Missing permissions block in workflow. Fix:

permissions:
  contents: write
